noun.description: A period of temporary economic decline during which trade and industrial activity are reduced, generally identified by a fall in GDP in two successive quarters.
examples: the country is in the depths of a recession
measures to pull the economy out of recession

noun.description: The action of receding; motion away from an observer.

origin: Mid 17th century: from Latin recessio(n-), from recess- gone back, from the verb recedere (see recede).
